questions.question: Which sentence correctly expresses a hypothetical present situation caused by a past mistake?
options: If she were more confident, she would have spoken at the meeting.
If she had been more confident, she would speak at the meeting now.
If she had been more confident, she would have spoken at the meeting.
If she was more confident, she speaks at the meeting now.
questions.answer: If she had been more confident, she would speak at the meeting now.

questions.question: Choose the mixed conditional that best reflects a present impossibility due to a past event:
options: If I hadn't missed the deadline, I would be presenting the project today.
If I don't miss the deadline, I will present the project today.
If I missed the deadline, I wouldn't present the project today.
If I hadn't missed the deadline, I would have presented the project today.
questions.answer: If I hadn't missed the deadline, I would be presenting the project today.
